result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Nicole Ostrowski has been appointed to represent the defendant.
Review hearing on April 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Proposed Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

02:20 PM Defendant Meghan A McWilliams in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  THE COURTS ORDERS FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.  The Court will schedule this matter before the Trial Court for a review on competency to tag along with the defendant's other matters.  Review hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
